New Records: Caden Dana became the youngest Angels pitcher to win his major league debut
Caden Dana is also the first pitcher in his big league debut to go at least six innings and permit two or fewer runs at his age or younger since Jordan Lyles on May 31, 2011
Key Match Events: Taylor Ward extended his hitting streak to 12 games with a leadoff homer
Anthony Rendon provided the go-ahead hit with a two-run single in the fifth
Caden Dana retired the first five hitters he faced before Raley connected on a fastball down the middle and drove it 433 feet into the left-center stands to tie it at 1
Post-Match Reflections: Caden Dana said it was a good feeling getting a win like that and getting a win like that helps going into the next outing
Ron Washington said Caden Dana proved to himself he can pitch in the big leagues
Dan Wilson said Caden Dana got deep enough into the game that their bullpen was able to take over
Miscellaneous Highlights: Seattle dropped to 5-4 since Dan Wilson replaced Scott Servais as manager on Aug. 22
The Angels host the Los Angeles Dodgers in a two-game Freeway Series beginning Tuesday
Caden Dana appeared in the MLB Futures Game in July and is considered the Angels' best pitching prospect
